content: hey crafters DM Scotty here we're back to our normal space-time no longer on my
ship of the imagination but today we're going to start a video that is dealing
with our adventure project so that's pretty cool so if you haven't food and
follow me on the forums or Facebook the adventure project is an adventure I'm
taking advice from the community and trying to craft a whole adventure the
adventure we've decided is an island adventure so to start this off I'm going
to have the classic where the adventurers are shipwrecked on this
island and I thought it'd be fun to have as they walk over there washed up on the
beach and they come to consciousness that there are pieces of the ship
scatter all over the island they're scattered on the beach so I'm my goal in
this video is to make some some ship pieces that would I can use to set on
the beach when the players come to and they can even search further down the
beach and try to find more ship pieces so let's go the table and I'll show you
some really easy methods to make those shipwreck pieces
my project is starting with a piece of regular cardboard see the corrugation
there now I'm going to mark the open corrugations on one side and then I'll
do it on the other side and now I'm going to use a straight edge and just
measure a car or just go across the cardboard I've got that all done I'm
just going to use a box cutter and just cut across and I'm just cutting the top
layer of cardboard so look see how that's flexible now that makes them
great planking for my shipwreck pieces now here's the
front part of the ship I did with that planking cardboard has cut the various
parts out and assembled them with hot glue and white glue so now I need to
kind of cover up some of those corrugations so I'm gonna use my glue
gun and cover up the corrugations on the wood that's facing up I'm also going to
do some distressing to the wood where it snapped just give it some extra detail
so I'm just pulling out from the edge the glue out from the edge and then I'll
just finish up by pulling it down on the planking on the side of the ship there
filling in some last details there we go so it's all ready now to strengthen it
up a bit I'm use of white glue I'm just gonna put it on there and then spread it
out this will help secure the boards
together because you know we did cut the top layer of cardboard and this was a
strengthen it up a bit so it's all ready to go
now here's another section I did same stuff I just used the the planking
cardboard you see it's a little bit bent I was trying to go for the hull of a
ship being been a bit and I used card stock strips on the back to kind of
strengthen the curve of that and keep it in the curve it'll be on the bottom
anyway so you won't see it now I want to do a mast and I'm going to use a paper
towel roll I'm just cutting that in half I'm using a stick to kind of help me
roll that up and now I'm going to tighten that up a bit and then get it
ready and use some glue gun on there you don't have to hold that for a minute to
secure that and that be my main mast I mean he's a scissors and cut off the end
cuz I wanted to look like it's broken off so I cut that now we used toilet
paper rolls and he's gonna be the cross masked crossbeam I've just rolling those
up with a pencil same deal I'm just using the hot glue cut off the end there
and then glue the non cut end to the mast itself make another one so I'll
make the other side same same way let's roll that back up blue in there this
time now I'm going to do a little different I'm going to cut this in half
so I'm gonna have part of it broken off and part of it stuck to the mast
so I'll secure that and there's the mast secure that up a bit all right so now I
want to add some fill in some of the the roles there with toilet paper I'm just
wetting them and using glue so I put some glue in there first and then just
put the wet toilet paper in there and that'll fill in the end of the the tubes
make it look like a solid mass as opposed to a tube and I'll just feel it
put some glue on the ends that'll secure that and harden it up so here I am I'll
dry now when I do some is distressing to the mast itself so I'm doing like I did
on the ship piece I'm just pulling some hot glue out from the edges and that
looked like the the wood snapped it'll just give it some detail see there you
go this'll extra detail and you can fill in
those edges too if you need to to shore them up to the edges of the rolls secure
the back there and it's good to go for the next step here I want to do some
sails I want to do some sales that were kind of like draped over the mast so I'm

glue to secure that it's the different layers just it's very wet so I'm just
draping it on feeling out a few spots some ripped
sales add some extra glue and we'll let that dry you see the cutting board also
helps with this project it won't stick to it so it's just a cheap cutting board
all right so now I want to secure the back so I'm going to add some glue to
the back and I'm just gonna spread that out the water helps us spread the glue
out it's fairly viscous so there I let that dry and I want to add one last
detail I'm gonna add some hemp rope to or some hemp string to look like rope so
I'm just wrapping that around the mast gluing it up and I can just drape it how
I like on the piece I'm gonna do one more putting on the larger mast just
wrap that around and just glue it up and then drape it how I like and there we go
it let that dry and we'll have a nice nice mast wash up on the beach all right
there we go hey guys I hope you liked the first of this adventure dams
